intro: Tradescantia occidentalis, commonly known as the spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, three-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in spring and early summer, producing vibrant blue or purple blooms. Tradescantia occidentalis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
